00035 /*
00036 *       A class terminating a Start-Stop Protocol. When the predecessor
00037 *       continues to send, if the sucessor has stopped us, then simply the input
00038 *       buffer overflows. But we ourselfs do what the successor expects.
00039 *
00040 *       TermStartStop xyz: BUF=100, OUT=tcpipsend->Data;
00041 *                               // BUFF size of input buffer
00042 *               Control input: xyz->Start
00043 *
00044 *       Exported:       xyz->Count      // number of lost data objects
00045 */
00046 
00047 #ifndef TERMSTRTSTP_INCL
00048 #define TERMSTRTSTP_INCL
00049 
00050 #include "in1out.h"
00051 #include "queue.h"
00052 
00053 //tolua_begin
00054 class termStartStop:    public  in1out  {
00055   typedef       in1out  baseclass;
00056 public:
00057   termStartStop(){}
00058   ~termStartStop(){}
00059   int act(void);
00060   rec_typ REC(data *, int);     // REC is a macro normally expanding to rec (for debugging)
00061   void  early(event *);
00062   inline void   sendTheGuy(data *pd) {
00063     lastSendTime = SimTime;
00064     chkStartStop(myState = suc->rec(pd, shand));
00065     if (myState == ContSend && q.getlen() != 0)
00066       alarme( &std_evt, 1);
00067   }
00068 
00069   queue q;
00070   rec_typ       myState;
00071   tim_typ       lastSendTime;
00072   
00073   enum {
00074     InpData = 0, 
00075     InpStart = 1
00076   };
00077 };
00078 //tolua_end
00079 #endif
